skill.name: interactive-planner
skill.description: Use Claude Code's interactive question tool to gather comprehensive requirements through structured multi-select questions
skill.summary: Use Claude Code's interactive question tool to gather comprehensive requirements through structured ...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It provides methodology and examples for using Claude Code's AskUserQuestion tool to gather requirements through interactive questions. No security risks identified.

content.value_statement: Transform vague project ideas into clear specifications through structured multi-choice questions. Eliminate ambiguity and missed requirements with systematic interactive planning.
actual_capabilities: Ask 4 structured questions per batch with 2-4 options each
Design question categories covering functionality, architecture, UX, quality, and constraints
Synthesize answers into actionable specification documents
Support 20-30 questions across 5-8 batches for comprehensive coverage
limitations: Maximum 4 questions per AskUserQuestion tool call
Requires user interaction - cannot work autonomously
Limited to predefined option sets, may miss edge cases
Best for new projects, less useful for simple changes

use_cases.title: Define MVP Features
use_cases.description: Scope minimum viable products by asking stakeholders about must-have features, technical constraints, and quality requirements through interactive questions.

use_cases.title: Client Requirements Gathering
use_cases.description: Systematically collect project requirements from clients using structured questions about technology preferences, timeline, budget, and feature priorities.

use_cases.title: Technical Architecture Planning
use_cases.description: Make informed decisions about tech stack, deployment strategy, authentication methods, and scalability needs through interactive planning sessions.

prompt_templates.title: New Project Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use interactive-planner to gather comprehensive requirements for a new e-learning platform with video streaming, user progress tracking, and payment integration. Ask 20-30 questions across multiple batches.

prompt_templates.title: Feature Addition
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding real-time chat to existing app
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add real-time messaging to my React app. Use interactive questions to understand requirements for chat features, message storage, notifications, and scalability needs.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me plan the refactoring of a monolithic PHP application. Use structured questions to determine migration approach, new architecture, testing strategy, and deployment plan.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to integrate Stripe payments and SendGrid emails. Use interactive planning to gather requirements for payment flows, email templates, error handling, and webhook implementation.

output_examples.input: Plan a new customer support ticket system
output: Project Type: Web application with real-time features
Primary Goal: Build production-ready support system
Backend: REST API with WebSocket support
Database: PostgreSQL for tickets, Redis for real-time
Features: Ticket creation, assignment, status tracking, real-time notifications, file attachments, search/filtering
Quality: Production MVP with 90% test coverage

best_practices: Start with broad questions about project type and goals, then progress to specific technical details
Use multi-select for features and integrations where users might want multiple options
Ask 20-30 questions total across 5-8 batches for comprehensive coverage
anti_patterns: Don't use for simple one-file changes - ask directly instead
Avoid overlapping question categories that collect duplicate information
Don't proceed with insufficient answers - ask clarifying follow-up questions

faq.question: How many questions should I ask?
faq.answer: Ask 20-30 questions across 5-8 batches for comprehensive coverage. Simple projects need fewer questions.

faq.question: Can users select multiple options?
faq.answer: Yes, enable multiSelect for questions where choices aren't mutually exclusive, like feature selection.

faq.question: What if users keep choosing 'Other'?
faq.answer: Your questions are too restrictive. Switch to open discussion or broaden your option sets.

faq.question: How do I handle vague answers?
faq.answer: Ask follow-up questions for clarification before proceeding to the next batch.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing projects?
faq.answer: Best for new projects. For existing work, ask specific questions about changes needed.

faq.question: What happens after gathering requirements?
faq.answer: The skill synthesizes answers into a specification document that you can use for implementation planning.
